sen.j: 武奈ヶ岳（ぶながたけ）は、滋賀県大津市にある、標高1214.4mの山。
sen.e: Mr. Bunagatake is a mountain which is 1,214.4 m high above sealevel and located in Otsu City in Shiga Prefecture.
Mr. Bunagatake is a mountain which is 1,214.4 m high above sealevel and located in Otsu City in Shiga Prefecture.
Mr. Bunagatake is a mountain which is 1,214.4 m high above sealevel and located in Otsu City in Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 滋賀県西部、湖西地方に位置する比良山地の最高峰である。
sen.e: It is the highest mountain in Hira mountains located in Kosei district in the western part of Shiga Prefecture.
It is the highest mountain in Hira mountains located in Kosei region in the western part of Shiga Prefecture.
It is the highest mountain in Hira mountains located in Kosei region in the western part of Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 琵琶湖国定公園の一部。
sen.e: It is a part of Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park.
It is a part of Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park.
It is a part of Lake Biwa Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 日本二百名山、近畿百名山の一つ。
sen.e: It is one of 200 top mountains in Japan and 100 top mountains in Kinki district.
It is one of 200 top mountains in Japan and 100 top mountains in Kinki region.
It is one of 200 top mountains in Japan and 100 top mountains in Kinki region.

sen.j: 武奈ヶ岳は、釈迦岳を最高峰とする北比良、同じく蓬莱山を中心とする南比良に対して、比良山地の北部を占める奥比良に位置している。
sen.e: Mt. Bunagatake is located in Okuhira which is in the northern part of Hira mountains as opposed to Kitahira having Mt. Shakagatake as the highest mountain and Minamihira centering on Mt. Horaisan.

Mt. Bunagatake is located in Okuhira (inner Hira) which is in the northern part of Hira mountains as opposed to Kitahira (northern Hira) having Mt. Shakagatake as the highest mountain and Minamihira (sothern Hira) centering on Mt. Horaisan.
sen.cmt: (inner Hira) (northern Hira) (sothern Hira)を追加しました。
sen.e: Mt. Bunagatake is located in Okuhira (inner Hira) which is in the northern part of Hira mountains as opposed to Kitahira (northern Hira) having Mt. Shakagatake as the highest mountain and Minamihira (sothern Hira) centering on Mt. Horaisan.

sen.j: 甞ては、リフトやロープウェイにて山麓と結ばれ、また、スキー場を有する、京阪神近郊有数の山岳観光地であったが、今日ではこれらは全て廃止されている。
sen.e: It was one of best mountain tourist spot in the suburb of Keihanshin (Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe) which was connected with the foot by lift and rope way and had a skiing slope, but all of them were abolished.

It was one of best mountain tourist spot in the suburb of Keihanshin (Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe) which was connected with the foot by lift and rope way and had a skiing slope, but all of them were abolished.

It was one of best mountain tourist spot in the suburb of Keihanshin (Osaka, Kyoto and Kobe) which was connected with the foot by lift and rope way and had a skiing slope, but all of them were abolished.

sen.j: 山名は、中腹部にブナの木が多く生えていることに由来していると言われている。
sen.e: It is said that the name of this mountain originates from many beech trees that grow in the mountainside.
It is said that the name of this mountain originates from many beech trees that grow in the mountainside.
It is said that the name of this mountain originates from many beech trees that grow in the mountainside.

sen.j: 頂上からは360度の展望を楽しむことができ、晴れた日には遠く、御嶽山や白山をも望むことができる。
sen.e: Landscape for 360 degrees can be enjoyed on the mountaintop and, on fine days, view of Mt. Mitake-yama and Mt. Hakusan can be enjoyed.
Landscape for 360 degrees can be enjoyed on the mountaintop and additionally, on fine days, view of Mt. Ontake and Mt. Hakusan can be enjoyed.
sen.cmt: スペル修正しました。Mt. Mitake-yama → Mt. Ontake
sen.e: Landscape for 360 degrees can be enjoyed on the mountaintop and additionally, on fine days, view of Mt. Ontake and Mt. Hakusan can be enjoyed.

sen.j: 武奈ヶ岳は、奥比良の他の山岳同様、中古生層にあり、砂岩や泥岩等の堆積岩により形成された露頭である。
sen.e: Same as other mountains in Okuhira, Mt. Bunagatake is in Chukoseiso and is an outcrop which is composed of sedimentary rocks such as sandstones, mudstones and so on.
sen.cmt: 「中古生層」の英語名が不明です。
sen.e: Same as other mountains in Okuhira, Mt. Bunagatake is in middle-paleozoic strata and is an outcrop which is composed of sedimentary rocks such as sandstones, mudstones and so on.
sen.cmt: 中古生層はMiddle Paleozoic strataとしました。
sen.e: Same as other mountains in Okuhira, Mt. Bunagatake is in middle-paleozoic strata and is an outcrop which is composed of sedimentary rocks such as sandstones, mudstones and so on.

sen.j: 比良索道株式会社が、1960年に、山麓からシャカ岳駅まで比良リフトを、そして、1961年には、シャカ岳駅から山上駅（比良ロープウェイ）まで比良ロープウェイを運行し、JR比良駅 (滋賀県)から山麓までの江若バスと合わせて、山頂近くと比良駅を結んでいた。
sen.e: Hira Sakudo Kabushikikaisha operated Hira lift from the foot of mountain to Shakadake Station since 1960 and Hira ropeway from Shakadeke Station to Sanjo-eki Station since 1961 and, together with Kojak Bus between JR Hira Station (Shiga Prefecture) to the foot of mountain, connected the vicinity of the mountaintop and Hira Station.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hira Sakudo Kabushikikaisha (Hira cableway., Ltd) operated Hira lift from the foot of mountain to Shakadake Station since 1960 and Hira ropeway from Shakadeke Station to Sanjo-eki Station since 1961 and, together with Kojak Bus between JR Hira Station (Shiga Prefecture) to the foot of mountain, connected the vicinity of the mountaintop and Hira Station.

Hira Sakudo Kabushikikaisha (Hira cableway., Ltd) operated Hira lift from the foot of mountain to Shakadake Station since 1960 and Hira ropeway from Shakadeke Station to Sanjo-eki Station since 1961 and, together with Kojak Bus between JR Hira Station (Shiga Prefecture) to the foot of mountain, connected the vicinity of the mountaintop and Hira Station.

sen.j: しかし、2004年にまず、リフトとロープウェイが、次いでバスが廃止され、山頂へのアクセスは大きく限られるようになった。
sen.e: However, the list and ropeway were discontinues at first in 2004 and then bus was discontinued and access to the mountaintop was strictly limited.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the lift and ropeway were discontinues at first in 2004 and then bus was discontinued and access to the mountaintop was strictly limited.
sen.cmt: スペル修正しました。list → lift
sen.e: However, the lift and ropeway were discontinues at first in 2004 and then bus was discontinued and access to the mountaintop was strictly limited.

sen.j: 江若バスガリバー旅行村バス停
sen.e: Gulliver Village Bus Stop of Kojak Bus
Gulliver Village Bus Stop of Kojak Bus
